definitions.definition: The belief or teaching that because only the spiritual "law of faith" (Romans 3:27) is essential for salvation , obedience to any practical or moral law has no role to play, even as a guide to conduct or as a test of the genuineness of faith .

main_definition: ( Christianity ) The belief or teaching that because only the spiritual "law of faith" (Romans 3:27) is essential for salvation , obedience to any practical or moral law has no role to play, even as a guide to conduct or as a test of the genuineness of faith .
